0.text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
0.author: Plato

1.text: The early bird catches the worm.
1.author: William Camden

2.text: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.
2.author: Glen Cook

3.text: The more we do, the more we can do.
3.author: William Hazlitt

4.text: Don't count the days, make the days count.
4.author: Muhammad Ali

5.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
5.author: Robert Collier

6.text: The future depends on what you do today.
6.author: Mahatma Gandhi

7.text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
7.author: Jim Rohn

8.text: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
8.author: Chris Grosser

9.text: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
9.author: Zig Ziglar

10.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
10.author: Confucius

11.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
11.author: Steve Jobs

12.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
12.author: Albert Schweitzer

13.text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
13.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

14.text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
14.author: Zig Ziglar

15.text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
15.author: Aristotle

16.text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
16.author: Charles R. Swindoll

17.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
17.author: Amelia Earhart

18.text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
18.author: Ralph Marston

19.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
19.author: Lao Tzu

20.text: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
20.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry

21.text: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
21.author: Cherie Gilderbloom

22.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
22.author: Theodore Roosevelt

23.text: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
23.author: Charlie Chaplin
